Environmental Issues: (a) Localized rill erosion prior to re-establishment of vegetation
Observations in 2010: •  Rill erosion was observed on the right-of-way at KP 8.3.
Observations in 2011: •  Rill erosion was observed on the right-of-way from KP 7.5 to KP 7.6, and KP 8.2 and KP 8.3.
Recommendations: Repair rill erosion and continue monitoring vegetation establishment and erosion potential in 2012.

Observations in 2010: •  Trench line subsidence was observed along the pipeline route at KP 1.6, KP 10.7, KP 11.3 and KP 11.6.
Observations in 2011: •  Trench line subsidence was observed along the right-of-way at KP 1.6.  •  No access granted to monitor subsidence at KP 10.7, KP 11.3 and KP 11.6 at time of survey.
Recommendations: Recontour the right-of-way as close to the preconstruction profile as possible in 2011 and monitor all locations in 2012.

Observations in 2010: •  Trench line subsidence was observed along the pipeline route at KP 7.5 and KP 8.1.
Observations in 2011: •  No subsidence issues were observed along the pipeline route at KP 7.5 or KP 8.1.

Environmental Issues: (a)  Lowering of soil capability through topsoil / subsoil admixing
Observations in 2010: •  Surface admixing was observed at KP 10.5. •  Crop harvested at KP 10.5.
Observations in 2011: •  No access granted to monitor admixing at KP 10.5 at time of survey.
Recommendations: Continue monitoring crop growth and soil erosion potential in 2012.

Environmental Issues: (b) Degradation of soil structure and lowering of soil capability through compaction and rutting
Observations in 2010: •  Moderate compaction was observed from KP 8.2 to KP 9.1 and at KP 10.5.
Observations in 2011: •  Moderate compaction was observed from KP 8.3 to KP 8.5 and from KP 8.9 to KP 9.05. •  No access granted to monitor compaction at KP 10.5 at time of survey.

Environmental Issues: (b) Degradation of soil structure and lowering of soil capability through compaction and rutting
Observations in 2010: •  Severe compaction was observed at KP 6.3 and from KP 12.2 to KP 13.1.
Observations in 2011: •  No compaction issues were observed along the pipeline route at KP 6.3 or from KP 12.2 to KP 13.1.

Environmental Issues: (c) Loss of topsoil through wind erosion
Observations in 2010: •  Topsoil loss was observed from KP 0.0 to KP 0.3 and at KP 5.2. •  Crop harvested from KP 0.0 to KP 0.3.
Observations in 2011: •  Topsoil loss was not observed to be an issue along the pipeline route.

Observations in 2010: •  Trench line subsidence was observed along the pipeline route at KP 1.6, KP 10.7, KP 11.3 and KP 11.6.
Observations in 2011: •  Trench line subsidence was observed along the pipeline route at KP 1.6.  •  No access granted to monitor subsidence at KP 10.7, KP 11.3 or KP 11.6 at time of survey.
Recommendations: Recontour the right-of-way as close to the preconstruction profile as possible in 2011 and monitor all locations in 2012.

Observations in 2010: •  Trench line subsidence was observed along the pipeline route at KP 7.5 and KP 8.1.
Observations in 2011: •  No subsidence issues were observed along the pipeline route at KP 7.5 or KP 8.1.

Observations in 2011: •  Trench line subsidence was observed along the pipeline route at KP 1.6.  •  No access granted to monitor subsidence at KP 10.7, KP 11.3 and KP 11.6 at time of survey.
Recommendations: Recontour the right-of-way as close to the preconstruction profile as possible in 2011 and monitor all locations in 2012.

Observations in 2010: •  Trench line subsidence was observed along the pipeline route at KP 7.5 and KP 8.1.
Observations in 2011: •  No subsidence issues were observed along the pipeline route at KP 7.5 or KP 8.1.

Environmental Issues: (a) Fish and fish habitat along the route
Observations in 2010: •  No alteration of fish habitat was observed during the 2010 PCEM program.
•  No increase in sedimentation observed during 2010 PCEM program.

Location: Pipeline Loop and areas of weed concern in SW 5-80-13 W6M and SE 8-80-13 W6M
Observations in 2010: •  Perennial sow-thistle was observed at trace densities from KP 1.3 to KP 2.5. •  Cleavers were observed at trace densities from KP 4.3 to KP 5.0.
Observations in 2011: •  Weeds were not observed to be an issue along the pipeline route.

Environmental Issues: (b) Alteration of vegetation important to wildlife
Observations in 2010: •  No adverse affects to important wildlife vegetation was observed during 2010 PCEM.

Observations in 2011: •  Poor crop establishment was observed along the pipeline route at KP 6.3.
